algorithm_technique: Bitwise operations to swap groups of bits efficiently.
Iterative bit shifting and checking to build the reversed integer.
problem_summary_simple: Reverse the bits of a 32-bit unsigned integer.
problem_summary_technical: Use bitwise shifts and masks to swap bits in stages (16, 8, 4, 2, 1 bits) or iterate through bits.
key_insights: The problem requires manipulating the binary representation of an integer.
The first solution uses a clever bit manipulation technique to reverse bits in a constant number of operations by swapping larger chunks of bits first.
The second solution iterates 32 times, extracting the least significant bit of the input and appending it to the most significant end of the result.
